programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood takes on his toughest challenge yet, working as a paramedic in Austin, Texas. His mentor is Cassi Lydon, a veteran paramedic with 14 years' service

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a Welsh chapel and terraced houses in Newcastle-under-Lyme and Offerton as they are sold at auction

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: France v Morocco (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the eighth and concluding last-16 match, which takes place at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. A record of two wins and one draw was enough to see France secure top spot in Group F ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama. Morocco looked unlikely qualifiers after losing their opener 6-0 against Germany, but wins against Korea Republic and group-winners Colombia saw them remarkably finish ahead of the Germans in second place

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton catches up with two house hunters who have moved to Dumfries and Galloway, including a buyer from 2019 whose literary ambitions have come to fruition

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. Dominic Chinea gets to work on an ingenious artist's tool from the 1920s and toy repairers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell give some TLC to a baby seal that is no longer very furry

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the borderlands of Radnorshire, searching for nesting birds along the Wye, dormice and roe deer in its woodlands. He also finds yellowhammers on Offa's Dyke

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Honey tries to get a very reluctant Ben to open up to Callum. Patrick has a big decision to make and Reiss tries to charm his way into Sonia's good books. Zack receives some good news

programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ruck Stars
programme.desc: Derby day finally arrives and amid lashing rain and last minute team changes, the Scarlets take on rivals the Ospreys in a dramatic clash, with both teams feeling the pressure. Cori and Wil need to prove themselves on the pitch if they're going to land an academy rugby contract. Kian hopes to win big in his new position, and James realises it's finally time to choose between sport and singing

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers how three years before her death, Gaia was approached online by an older man who turned out to be at the centre of a world of webcamming and online grooming in Dorset. Despite multiple warnings from those closest to her, Gaia wanted to help him and they became close

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end of life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton discuss whether Britain has a moral duty to help poorer nations in light of a Foreign Office report stating that thousands of women in Africa will die in pregnancy and childbirth as a result of cuts to the UK's overseas aid budget. Also, after reports that the government is set to tighten up sentencing guidelines for offences such as shoplifting, we'll discuss whether sending petty criminals to prison is the right thing to do. Anita Rani discusses this year's South Asian Heritage Month

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Documentary following gay Christian couple Grace and Jess as they prepare to move into their first home together, a canal boat, leaving behind the family, friends and church community that refuse to accept them. They hope that once they are settled, they can find a new church and community that welcomes them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts. Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the transformation of terraced houses in Abbey Wood, south-east London, and Carlisle, as well as a seven-year project on a large period house in Torquay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts, as experts Philip Serrell and Richard Madley help teams scouring the streets of Hungerford, Berkshire, pick up items to sell for profit at auction

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits St Barts in London, the UK's oldest hospital, to discover how it began as a monastery after a vision from God, and finds out how faith is still at work today. Plus, Laura Wright meets two sisters in Birmingham with a love of singing who were the first conjoined twins in the UK to undergo a life-saving procedure

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists Daniel Heath to give new life to a retro bureau picked up from Woking Recycling Centre. For her own project, Sarah has three wooden doors to get creative with

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's road race on day four of the Championship, which consists of a 170-mile route from Edinburgh to Glasgow. Since Tom Simpson became the first in 1965, only one other Briton has claimed the coveted rainbow jersey in this event - Mark Cavendish in 2011. Rising Belgian star Remco Evenepoel took victory at last year's race, powering away from his rivals during the closing stages. France's Christophe Laporte secured silver, and Australian Michael Matthews took bronze

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A dog-friendly garden is a top priority today for Nicki Chapman's buyer in Devon, who has £350,000 to spend on a new home for her and her much-loved pet pooch

programme.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Wollaton Hall in Nottingham, where treasures include a fire extinguisher cocktail shaker, a toy monkey popping out of a musical pineapple, and underwear belonging to Queen Victoria. Fiona also learns about local activist George Powe, who campaigned to secure employment opportunities for black workers at Raleigh in the 1950s, and guesses the value of three cameo items

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Kasia takes on her first assignment as an agent - shadowing a Polish woman working in an aircraft factory in Manchester who is suspected of sending information to the Nazis. Rajib's military values are tested when he learns his men are receiving worse rations than their allies, and he is torn between duty and ideal. Meanwhile, a familiar face comes to David's aid

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Hibernian v St Mirren. Action from both team's opening match of the Scottish Premiership season, which took place at Easter Road

programme.title: The King's Speech (2010)
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Nigeria (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the fifth last-16 match at Lang Park in Brisbane, Australia. England topped their group with a 100 per cent record, labouring to 1-0 wins over Haiti and Denmark, before finding their best form in their final match with an emphatic 6-1 victory over China. Nigeria finished second in Group B after goalless draws with Canada and Republic of Ireland either side of a shock 3-2 victory over Australia

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Denmark (Kick-off 11.30am). Coverage of the sixth last-16 match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney. Despite a defeat at the hands of Nigeria in their second match, victories over Republic of Ireland and Canada gave the co-hosts top spot in Group B, while Denmark finished second in Group D after wins against China and Haiti either side of a loss to England

programme.title: Wolf

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray guest hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with writer and presenter Richard Osman and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: England football midfielder Jill Scott inspires the next generation of Lionesses to success at her childhood club in the north-east. Boldon CA Girls is the grassroots football club that has produced three Lionesses - Jill Scott, Demi Stokes and captain Steph Houghton. Now the young players at Boldon are training hard and dreaming big. After the success of the England women's team winning Euro 2022, these girls believe they can do it too

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a mother and daughter-in-law from Bristol, two friends from Basingstoke and Camberley, and neighbours from Nottingham

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case, arranging a prison visit and listening to recordings of Lincoln interviewing Sophie and Hugo's classmates. When challenged by Lincoln, he reveals the secrets of his own past. Honey discovers CCTV cameras set up in the garden, and begins to suspect that he and Molina are pawns in someone's elaborate game

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: A unique insight into living with dwarfism, through the experiences of Tricia Mailey and two of her children, who were born with achondroplasia, the most common form of dwarfism. Primary school teacher Tricia Mailey is mum to Cara, 12, Noah, 5, and one-year-old Bethany. Tricia and husband Sean run a home filled with laughter and love, but what makes this everyday family so unique is that Tricia and her two elder children have the height-restricting condition achondroplasia, while Sean and Bethany are average-height

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray guest hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with writer and presenter Richard Osman and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a mother and daughter-in-law from Bristol, two friends from Basingstoke and Camberley, and neighbours from Nottingham

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood takes on his toughest challenge yet, working as a paramedic in Austin, Texas. His mentor is Cassi Lydon, a veteran paramedic with 14 years' service

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a Welsh chapel and terraced houses in Newcastle-under-Lyme and Offerton as they are sold at auction

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: France v Morocco (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the eighth and concluding last-16 match, which takes place at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. A record of two wins and one draw was enough to see France secure top spot in Group F ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama. Morocco looked unlikely qualifiers after losing their opener 6-0 against Germany, but wins against Korea Republic and group-winners Colombia saw them remarkably finish ahead of the Germans in second place

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton catches up with two house hunters who have moved to Dumfries and Galloway, including a buyer from 2019 whose literary ambitions have come to fruition

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. Dominic Chinea gets to work on an ingenious artist's tool from the 1920s and toy repairers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell give some TLC to a baby seal that is no longer very furry

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the holiday makers who arrived at their hotels only to discover they'd been closed for years

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Honey tries to get a very reluctant Ben to open up to Callum. Patrick has a big decision to make and Reiss tries to charm his way into Sonia's good books. Zack receives some good news

programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bikes!
programme.desc: Stephen Watson presents highlights of the motorcycling event from County Antrim, which was first held in 1977. Despite being the youngest Irish road-racing event, it has grown into a must-see meeting that attracts the sport's biggest names

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers how three years before her death, Gaia was approached online by an older man who turned out to be at the centre of a world of webcamming and online grooming in Dorset. Despite multiple warnings from those closest to her, Gaia wanted to help him and they became close

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end of life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg talks to John Wilson about the influences that shaped her career, including her earliest experiences of acting with a children's community project in New York, and being encouraged by her mother to make the most of free cultural opportunities in the city, including museums and public lectures, which fuelled her fascination with language. She also recalls meeting Mike Nichols, Oscar-winning director of The Graduate, who, after seeing her solo stage show in San Francisco, directed her on Broadway theatre

programme.desc: Gregor MacLeod and home bakers from across Scotland share their bread-baking recipes. Gregor reveals the trick to the classic French croissant with its layers of flaky puff pastry. He fills his with a generous helping of chocolate. He's also out and about sampling many tasty loaves - from a cheese and onion tear ‘n' share bread with a crispy cheesy crust, to moist, fruity hot cross buns

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Learner Mirren Buchanan from Thurso chats to Joy Dunlop in the studio, and Calum Maclean visits Ayrshire, where he gets to know some powerful local inhabitants

programme.title: Sgoil nan Sagart/Priest School
programme.desc: Following Ronald Campbell from Benbecula, who is studying for the priesthood in Rome

programme.title: All That Lies Behind Me (Sgeulachd Donald Merrett)
programme.desc: Using dramatic reconstructions and expert opinion, John Morrison revisits the story of John Donald Merrett - a murderer who, having been cleared of killing his mother in 1927, spent the next 30 years on a spree across Europe, spending a large inheritance on women and the black market. The programme also reveals how when Merrett returned to Britain, he killed his wife and mother-in-law, before committing suicide

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd gets his head wedged between the two panes of a double-glazed window while trying to get a trapped raisin - as the sun comes out, Abacus and PB realise that only Berry is small enough to rescue him, but Lloyd would rather bake than be rescued by Berry...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB sets Lloyd up in a fight with Dotty the ladybird's brother Freckles - worried that he'll defeat a little ladybird with ease, Lloyd makes himself as weak and unfit as possible to make the fight fairer, but Freckles is not the weak opponent he expected...

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Elmer visits Daffy for a quick shoe shine. / Wile E. Coyote clones himself to catch the Road Runner. / Porky is running late for movie night, but finding an available parking spot turns out to be more difficult than he imagined

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Bugs races against Cecil the Turtle for the title of 'fastest thing in New York City.' / The only thing more painful than Porky's sore tooth is a visit to dentist Daffy

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. A prestigious diamond on display at the British Museum has just been stolen and the theft bears the signature of Warragul, the infamous diamond gnome. The problem is that the criminal in question is still imprisoned in the high-security section of Greenside.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is chosen to compete in an important general knowledge quiz. But someone steals JC's fly swatter while she's revising in the library. JC, along with Amber as his super-detective, prevent all students present from leaving the library until the culprit is unmasked. To help Sam get away, Mo asks the Scepter for the power of polymorphism. But the half-power is erratic... and only the head changes!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Disaster! Mo is unwittingly recorded on the school's surveillance camera while using a power. Fortunately for our duo, Mo isn't recognisable on the video. But Brick is feverish, he's utterly determined to find out who's behind this 'supernatural being'. Mo and Sam manage to keep their identity secret, but HORRORS! JC announces he is the superhero on camera! He declares his 'superhero' name is 'Swatteroo The Sublime' and that he's gifted with astonishing super powers.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The model and Loose Women panellist is joined by comedian and actor Joe Thomas, while there is advice from experts and tips for entertainment in the week ahead

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Sweden v USA (Kick-off 10.00am). Coverage of the fourth-last 16 match, held at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. Sweden finished third four years ago and were in excellent form in Group G, winning their matches against South Africa, Italy and Argentina. The Americans are the holders, but they have failed to play their best football so far, finishing second in Group E after a win against Vietnam and draws with Netherlands and Portugal. Presented by Laura Woods, with analysis from Fran Kirby and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: Jason shares his love of fresh produce with a trip to a supersized vegetable market, then makes a tomato tartare with black olive tapenade, and a pudding made with beetroot and carrot. . He is joined by chef Mohamed Orfali, who visits a farm just outside Dubai that grows vegetables in desert sand

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: TV presenters Kate Garraway and Alison Hammond embark on a road trip to find out about their family history using a mix of DNA and genealogy, and by meeting living family members they never knew existed. Kate is excited as she is heading to London to meet her cousins for the first time. For Alison, visiting Jamaica - the homeland of her recently deceased mum, is an incredibly emotional and moving journey, one that brings her closer to her mum as she finds out the most jaw-dropping of maternal histories

programme.title: FA Community Shield Live
programme.desc: Manchester City v Arsenal (Kick-off 4.00pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Emma Hayes to present coverage of the traditional curtain-raiser to the top-flight campaign, held at Wembley Stadium. The Citizens won a Premier League, FA Cup and UEFA Champions League treble last term, but have lost in this match in each of the previous two campaigns, to Leicester City and then Liverpool. Arsenal, who finished second in the Premier last term, last appeared in this competition in 2019, when they defeated Liverpool on penalties. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Lizzy Swann is found dead at the bottom of a cliffside coastal walkway, but what appears at first to be a terrible accident, quickly becomes a murder investigation as Vera discovers evidence the body has been tampered with. Interviews with those who knew Lizzy paint a troubling picture of a guarded and paranoid woman who seemed to be burning bridges with friends and family alike in the days leading up to her death

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Elliott and Lily now have to assume that no one can be trusted and must get to Blunt before anyone else to interrogate him and confirm their suspicions about Sir Roger Hollis. Angleton hears of the death of his two agents in Moscow and realises he's been played by Philby, so he arranges for the apprehension and rendition of Blunt to a CIA safe house

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follows the stories of two women looking for siblings given up for adoption, but for very different reasons. Jeanette Woodyatt wants to find the brother she has never met and who was turned away from the family by her grandmother, while Karen Turnbull yearns to let her twin siblings know that their mother gave them up for adoption so they would have a better life

programme.title: Kate Garraway's Life Stories
programme.desc: Kate Garraway is joined by entertainer, author and Strictly Come Dancing star Anton Du Beke. From his struggles growing up on a council estate in Kent to winning a National Television Award for best TV judge, Kate delves into Du Beke's remarkable rise from a provincial dance school to one of the biggest shows on British television. But behind the showbiz sparkle, we'll hear how Anton went through many years of struggle, some of which he speaks about for the very first time

programme.title: Romeo & Duet
programme.desc: Oti Mabuse presents the dating show that uses the power of singing to help people find their ideal partners, with Owen, Charlotte, Amba-Jae and Adazae taking part this time. Each of the singletons will be serenaded by up to four singers and if they like what they hear they make their way to the bottom of the stairs to choose their favourite, opening the door and locking in their choice before the performance comes to an end. Each of the four new couples then compete to be crowned the winners by the studio audience and bag themselves a second date

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. In the first episode, Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong make up the panel, trying to identify the performers inside a bee, a duck, a unicorn, a hedgehog, a butterfly and a chameleon

programme.title: Paul Sinha's TV Showdown
programme.desc: The Chaser star, stand-up and trivia genius Paul Sinha hosts the comedy quiz show, as team captains Fay Ripley and Rob Beckett are joined by guests Katherine Ryan, Denise Lewis, Gregg Wallace and Big Zuu to test their TV knowledge

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Thruxton, featuring the Porsche Carrera Cup GB and the Mini 7 Racing Club National Championship

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley's adventure brings him to North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh, where he attends a pottery lesson to learn how to make authentic tagine pots, and makes a dish that is a true celebration of Morocco, a sweet potato and butternut squash tagine. Later, he hits the main square in Marrakesh for some street food, before heading to the kitchen to prepare harissa and preserved lemon chicken skewers

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: The presenter makes his way to Seville in southern Spain, where he visits the San Leandro convent, where nuns have been selling homemade sweets to visitors for 400 years. Then, he finds the perfect spot for his cookbook kitchen, where he whips up a charred orange and spiced almond salad. Later, Ainsley learns about all things Iberico ham from deli owner Elio, before heading back to his pop up kitchen to whip up a sandwich

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Laura and Kirsty from Birmingham, Iqra and her mum Rhaina from Birmingham, and Hertfordshire sisters Lydia and Celeste use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Maitland, Andrew, Hannah and Jason pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel and Jai's plans are jeopardised. Nate taps into a way of making extra money. Amelia wants them to flee but Dan disagrees

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Staff and regulars unite to help Jenny to save the Rovers, Rufus's widow alarms Stephen with an update on the inquest, and Stu catches Eliza meeting a strange man

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men hoping to find birth family. Joe McGregor was adopted as a baby in Bermuda in the 1970s and grew up in Norfolk in a loving family, yet he still yearns to find his birth family. Simon Miller's mum's dying wish was that he should find the daughter who she gave up for adoption just a few years before he was born

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. Featuring interviews with people who knew her or were involved with the investigation, with revealing police interview footage and CCTV

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the opening fixtures of the season, including Middlesbrough v Millwall at Riverside Stadium and Blackburn Rovers v West Bromwich Albion at Ewood Park and Norwich City v Hull City at Carrow Road in the Championship

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili host the quiz as Luan, Ben, Charley, Alex, Rhian, Adrienne, Stuart, Richard and Denise try to be among the four that make the final round for chance to win the four-digit jackpot defined by the number they were each assigned at the start

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands, including creating the soles of Dr Marten's, and making Wagon Wheels. Narrated by Jimmy Nail

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Colombia v Jamaica (Kick-off 9.00am). Live coverage of the seventh last-16 match, which takes place at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. Colombia topped Group H despite a shock 1-0 defeat against Morocco in their final contest, having already defeated Korea Republic and pre-tournament group favourites Germany. Jamaica claimed second place in Group F despite only scoring one goal in three matches, which was good enough for a 1-0 win over Panama, sandwiched between 0-0 draws against France and Brazil. Presented by Laura Woods, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Pien Meulensteen and Emma Hayes

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares tasty recipes as well as chatting with celebrity guests, who reminisce about their favourite meals

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Gareth Ward for a tour of Mid Wales. They begin at a cider-tasting, which James uses to dish up some cider-infused apple fritters. Gareth discovers a farm where the Wagyu cattle fed on local beer. Away from the culinary activities, Gareth is challenged to a rally car ride and James demonstrates his dog training prowess with his trusty hound Cooper

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words hosted by Adil Ray. Fighting it out today are Natassja and her Auntie Ashley from Northern Ireland, and married couples Jay and Shruti from Hertfordshire and Ian and Mary from Devon

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Gordon, Peter, Chloe and Helen pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel decides to join Jai in India but is captured by Colin. Nate double deals. Dan makes a decision about his future

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets four-year-old Lucy, who has travelled down from Glasgow for the latest check-up to monitor her pulmonary hypertension - a high blood pressure condition that affects the lungs. He also meets 13-year-old Connor, who is on the isolation ward as he prepares for a bone marrow transplant to help treat leukaemia. As the youngster needs to live in a sterile environment to protect his weakened immune system, Paul can only speak to him through a window - but that doesn't stop him finding a number of fun and interesting ways to keep Connor occupied during his recovery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. Katie Rushworth creates a contemporary water-feature-cum-bench that would look good in any garden and Frances Tophill shows how soft naturalistic planting with the emphasis on scent can create the perfect garden for wellness

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the final of the celebrity cookery series, as the three remaining stars face their toughest challenge yet in a bid to walk off with the title. The stakes are high, and only one will be crowned this year's winner

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Code Blue: Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary revealing how detectives solved two murders - from the first 'Code Blue' call to the crime scene, through to the convictions of the killers. In the first part, a 999 call from a distraught daughter launches a murder investigation to find the brutal killer of a beloved grandmother, June Fox-Roberts. With access to the South Wales Police's Major Crimes Unit, detectives try to identify the killer through CCTV footage in the hours before and after June's death

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from the sixth meeting of the season, held at the Croft Circuit, where the 16th, 17th and 18th races of the season took place. With commentary by David Addison and Tim Harvey, and reports from Louise Goodman

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panellists - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - try to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Keith, Heather, Bal, Jack, Lucy, Karen, Michael, Lynne and Steve battle one another in the hope of taking their number to the final and winning the prize pot. Omid Djalili hosts

programme.title: Gino's Cooking Up Love
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts a dating show with a culinary twist, as he opens his cooking school to six singles looking for love, while also teaching them how to cook authentic, Italian cuisine. Will they find a connection through a shared passion for food, and how will the arrival of three new students stir things up?

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How traditional seaside rock is made, a process that has not changed since Victorian times. Plus, how a new fire extinguisher is saving lives around the world. Jimmy Nail narrates

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Karen meets the five-time African Women's Footballer of the Year Asisat Oshoala, who has given girls the chance to chase their dreams through her foundation in Lagos, Nigeria

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fishing Allstars
programme.desc: Dean Macey and Adam Rooney travel to Dorset with England international angler Matt Godfrey, where they target a 20lb carp on an overnight challenge, before trying their hand at sea fishing for wrasse at Portland Bill, and finally trying to catch a 5lb chub at Throop Fishery

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd gets his head wedged between the two panes of a double-glazed window while trying to get a trapped raisin - as the sun comes out, Abacus and PB realise that only Berry is small enough to rescue him, but Lloyd would rather bake than be rescued by Berry...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB sets Lloyd up in a fight with Dotty the ladybird's brother Freckles - worried that he'll defeat a little ladybird with ease, Lloyd makes himself as weak and unfit as possible to make the fight fairer, but Freckles is not the weak opponent he expected...

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Elmer visits Daffy for a quick shoe shine. / Wile E. Coyote clones himself to catch the Road Runner. / Porky is running late for movie night, but finding an available parking spot turns out to be more difficult than he imagined

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Bugs races against Cecil the Turtle for the title of 'fastest thing in New York City.' / The only thing more painful than Porky's sore tooth is a visit to dentist Daffy

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. A prestigious diamond on display at the British Museum has just been stolen and the theft bears the signature of Warragul, the infamous diamond gnome. The problem is that the criminal in question is still imprisoned in the high-security section of Greenside.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is chosen to compete in an important general knowledge quiz. But someone steals JC's fly swatter while she's revising in the library. JC, along with Amber as his super-detective, prevent all students present from leaving the library until the culprit is unmasked. To help Sam get away, Mo asks the Scepter for the power of polymorphism. But the half-power is erratic... and only the head changes!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Disaster! Mo is unwittingly recorded on the school's surveillance camera while using a power. Fortunately for our duo, Mo isn't recognisable on the video. But Brick is feverish, he's utterly determined to find out who's behind this 'supernatural being'. Mo and Sam manage to keep their identity secret, but HORRORS! JC announces he is the superhero on camera! He declares his 'superhero' name is 'Swatteroo The Sublime' and that he's gifted with astonishing super powers.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The model and Loose Women panellist is joined by comedian and actor Joe Thomas, while there is advice from experts and tips for entertainment in the week ahead

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Sweden v USA (Kick-off 10.00am). Coverage of the fourth-last 16 match, held at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. Sweden finished third four years ago and were in excellent form in Group G, winning their matches against South Africa, Italy and Argentina. The Americans are the holders, but they have failed to play their best football so far, finishing second in Group E after a win against Vietnam and draws with Netherlands and Portugal. Presented by Laura Woods, with analysis from Fran Kirby and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: Jason shares his love of fresh produce with a trip to a supersized vegetable market, then makes a tomato tartare with black olive tapenade, and a pudding made with beetroot and carrot. . He is joined by chef Mohamed Orfali, who visits a farm just outside Dubai that grows vegetables in desert sand

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: TV presenters Kate Garraway and Alison Hammond embark on a road trip to find out about their family history using a mix of DNA and genealogy, and by meeting living family members they never knew existed. Kate is excited as she is heading to London to meet her cousins for the first time. For Alison, visiting Jamaica - the homeland of her recently deceased mum, is an incredibly emotional and moving journey, one that brings her closer to her mum as she finds out the most jaw-dropping of maternal histories

programme.title: FA Community Shield Live
programme.desc: Manchester City v Arsenal (Kick-off 4.00pm). Simon Miller's mum's dying wish was that he should find the daughter who she gave up for adoption just a few years before he was born

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Colombia v Jamaica (Kick-off 9.00am). Live coverage of the seventh last-16 match, which takes place at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. Colombia topped Group H despite a shock 1-0 defeat against Morocco in their final contest, having already defeated Korea Republic and pre-tournament group favourites Germany. Jamaica claimed second place in Group F despite only scoring one goal in three matches, which was good enough for a 1-0 win over Panama, sandwiched between 0-0 draws against France and Brazil. Presented by Laura Woods, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Pien Meulensteen and Emma Hayes

programme.desc: Paul meets four-year-old Lucy, who has travelled down from Glasgow for the latest check-up to monitor her pulmonary hypertension - a high blood pressure condition that affects the lungs. He also meets 13-year-old Connor, who is on the isolation ward as he prepares for a bone marrow transplant to help treat leukaemia. As the youngster needs to live in a sterile environment to protect his weakened immune system, Paul can only speak to him through a window - but that doesn't stop him finding a number of fun and interesting ways to keep Connor occupied during his recovery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. programme.desc: Routines by comedians including Tom Ward, Suzi Ruffell, Nigel Ng, Carl Hutchison, Nabil Abdulrashid, Olga Koch, Jack Barry and Joel Dommett are reconstructed as sketches

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Routines by comedians Michael Odewale, Michael Stranney, Tom Lucy, Felicity Ward, Larry Dean, Esther Manito, Babatunde Aleshe and Finlay Christie are reconstructed as sketches

programme.title: Iain Stirling's CelebAbility
programme.desc: The hilarious Iain Stirling is joined by returning team captain Scarlett Moffat as she leads a group of three friends looking to win a slew of fabulous prizes by defeating four celebrities - Eyal Booker, Sophie Hermann, Lou Sanders and Seann Walsh - in a series of silly games based on the unusual abilities the celebs believe they possess.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: A selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, including the tallest human pyramid and the longest ramp jump with a caravan. Matt Edmondson narrates

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Caroline asks the feuding pair to supply the entertainment for her charity luncheon, but soon regrets her decision. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack tackles what promises to be the most sensitive and unenviable investigation of his entire career - deciding whether a man with Down's syndrome is capable of committing murder. David Jason stars as the caustic copper, with Bruce Alexander and Matthew Marsh

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A confrontation between hunt stewards and saboteurs leads to the suspicious death of a protester - and makes Jack wonder whether the thrill of the chase has given the horsey set a taste for human blood. Whodunit, starring David Jason as DI Frost, with Bruce Alexander, Sean Pertwee, Del Henney and Tat Whalley

programme.title: Carry On Abroad (1972)
programme.desc: British holiday-makers jet off on a package holiday to the Spanish resort of Elsbels. Unluckily, not only is the hotel short of staff, but it also has no walls, ceilings or entertainment. Further mishaps leave the tourists fuming - until they sample a local punch laced with an aphrodisiac. Comedy, with Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaw's Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange building's various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Miss Marple uncovers secrets from the past about Miss Greenshaw as a dangerous storm gathers and the bodies start to pile up. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsy's Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Judi Dench's Wild Borneo Adventure
programme.desc: Part one of two. The award-winning actress embarks on a trip of a lifetime to uncover the lush rainforests, magical wildlife and spectacular coastlines of Malaysian Borneo. Judi experiences the rainforest for the first time in a thrilling 100-mile helicopter ride to the heart of the island with expert Glen Reynolds, before observing orangutans in the wild and learning how they are helping to prevent global warming

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As her Silk Road journey continues, Joanna travels to the Islamic Republic of Iran, where she meets many people eager to share the culture and innovations of the Persian civilisation, which spread far beyond modern day Iran. From ancient water gardens created to be paradise on Earth, through desert cities, endless bazaars and majestic mosques, Joanna discovers a country brimming with hospitality and warmth. Her Iranian adventure finishes in the Persian Empire's ancient ceremonial capital, Persepolis

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The leader of a censorship campaign comes to Oxford on a speaking tour, and Morse is charged with protecting her in light of a series of death threats. A bricklayer working on a controversial pop singer's house is later found dead, and when a second killing occurs, a connection emerges to the speaker's movement, plunging Morse into the middle of a conflict over the nature of British culture

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James blames Richard's interference when his offer of marriage is rejected by Hazel, but a visit from his beloved's father reveals the truth of the situation

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: As the staff come to terms with the recent tragic events, new ambulance driver Bobby makes a dramatic entrance. Marian finds herself a partner for the gig by Alun's band - but the evening ends in chaos when a fire breaks out at the overcrowded club. Up on the moors, a shooting incident leaves Ormerod and Bobby in danger and the mountain rescue team is called out to an elderly lady lying wounded outside her decaying farmhouse. Guest starring former Coronation Street star Sean Wilson

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Burnett is called out to a dilapidated farmhouse, where a teenager is running a high fever and his family seems to be struggling to cope. As the staff try to diagnose the youngster's illness, his pregnant mother is rushed to the hospital with the same symptoms and is left fighting for her life. Meanwhile, Ormerod and Rose attend to Sir Edward Fawcett, an eccentric explorer who wants to hike around Mexico, despite having a condition that means his days of adventure are over. Medical drama, guest starring Brian Blessed and Phyllis Logan

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The surly detective tries to get out of attending a reunion of George Cross holders because a serial rapist has struck again on his patch. Righteous indignation prompts him to take the most desperate professional gamble of his entire career by using PC Hazel Wallace as bait in a trap. He eventually picks up a lead involving the most recent victim's father, but comes under pressure from within the force to back down or be thrown off the case. David Jason stars

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon's love life hots up when an old flame reappears on the scene. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott sweet-talks Dawn during her first day at work, Chastity wangles a job at the cafe and Katie tries to rid herself of Robert's unsettling presence

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Terry tries to look after TJ. Dawn finds it tough being a working mum and is all too ready to take up Scott's offer of a much-needed drink at the end of the day

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey goes into debt to pay off Gail's mortgage, the Grimshaws are left holding the baby and Karen makes a public display of taking her wedding ring off in the Rovers

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail adopts a calmer approach to try to get Sarah back on side, and Jason reacts angrily to Eileen's double standards

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver's weekend break proves to be anything but relaxing as the feuding pair spend the entire time at loggerheads. To make matters worse, each is hoping to secure the same grandfather clock going under the hammer at a nearby auction. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon admits a secret about his birth to Oliver - only for his rival to exchange an even more bizarre confidence in return. Doris Hare (On the Buses) guest stars, with Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise announcement on his birthday that causes an argument between Weatherill and Ormerod, but the celebrations are interrupted when a bus full of day-trippers plunges down a nearby embankment. Susie bets Lizzie she will get Carnegie to ask her out, and Jack is given a fright when a body in the mortuary springs back to life. Rural drama starring Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanagh and co-starring Gareth Hale

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: With Susie and Carnegie's relationship the talk of the hospital, Matron reaches the end of her tether when her niece turns up late for work and she decides to suspend her. Mr Rose faces a personal trial when his golfing friend ends up in the operating room and Dr Burnett wrestles with a dilemma. Ormerod and Bobby try to rescue a farmer who is trapped under a combine harvester. Starring Sarah Beck Mather, Wendy Craig and Damian O'Hare

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar finds himself in an awkward position when the police investigate a warehouse robbery. A lost property clear-out at the police station gives David a new hobby, but he soon manages to cause trouble. Starring Derek Fowlds and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton investigates a suspicious death with the help of CID and Walker begins to suspect a poacher may be involved. Vernon tempts fate by employing a new mechanic for the garage without asking Bernie and attempts to recreate a traditional dance at the town fete. Guest starring Hannah Gordon

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn struggles to cope with her conflicting feelings for Scott, while Katie is driven to distraction by Robert and Donna's noisy antics, and Val has a spring in her step - much to Diane's amusement

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Katie is stunned to find Robert sneaking Donna into the Sugden house, while Val's upfront approach scares the living daylights out of Danny, and Emily makes a shocking discovery at Holdgate Farm

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Joe is forced to tell Karen the truth about his plans for the takeover bid after she spots a strange invoice, a lie comes home to roost for Curly, and Gail apologises to Sarah for being so heavy-handed

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Karen agrees to become part of Joe's takeover scheme, the truth about the surprise visit of Mike's son Adam comes out and Curly plays the dutiful husband by agreeing to go to Emma's works gathering.

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is taken hostage while interviewing a suspect, but somehow manages to talk his way out of trouble - quite an achievement for a man whose lack of tact is legendary. Having experienced what it's like to look down a gun barrel, he barges into a nearby Army camp where investigators are trying to solve a soldier's murder, but finds his help isn't appreciated. With David Jason, Bruce Alexander, Sam Kelly, Nicholas Jones and Saira Todd

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy is forced to confront painful memories when he is subjected to a series of attacks and Walker begins to suspect a recently released prisoner may be involved. Lord Ashfordly's visiting relatives receive a cool reception and Bernie is shocked to find Rosie working at the garage, but impressed once he discovers her lucrative new venture. Starring Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton and Walker investigate a security van raid in Ashfordly and are convinced there is a link to a recent robbery at a local airfield, but a senior officer visiting from Middlesbrough dismisses their claims. Vernon takes a sudden interest in the flower show when he discovers David might be the owner of a rare, potentially prize-winning fuchsia and turns to Blaketon and Ventress for help when the plant suddenly disappears

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse is assigned to protect an informant who is undergoing emergency surgery. The case brings back unpleasant memories for the detective, while his colleagues are thrown into disarray when Bright is also rushed to hospital. Morse becomes fixated with a series of mysterious deaths that have occurred on the ward, and tries to find the scientific explanation behind stories of a curse

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A murder inquiry is launched when the police are alerted to shocking internet footage showing a teenage girl being attacked and shot. The investigation is hindered by the lack of a body, but the video provides enough clues to eventually put a name to the victim and track down her killers. However, a vow of silence between the defendants means Jake and Alesha face one of their toughest court battles yet

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig

programme.desc: Simon learns the property next to the antique shops is being sold to a fast food chain and that the deal is being handled by oily estate agent Brimley, with whom he was at school. Brimley claims he will only reconsider the sale if Simon and Oliver pay him a hefty bribe, but when it transpires he is having an extramarital affair, the duo hold the upper hand

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Burnett races to save two schoolgirls who have fallen unconscious with carbon monoxide poisoning, while Susie has to think fast when Matron collapses during their picnic and ends up in hospital, giving the student nurse the chance to prove herself. Elsewhere, Weatherill gets to the bottom of a family problem involving a man training for the priesthood. Damian O'Hare, Sarah Beck Mather and Wendy Craig star

programme.desc: Sister Brigid helps secure a future for Moira and her baby, but when events take a shocking turn Weatherill and Ormerod are left to make a heartbreaking decision. Susie tries her best to be a model nurse and breaks off her relationship with Carnegie - who then proposes to her - while Bobby takes matters into his own hands with the violent stepfather of a local thug. Linda Armstrong, Amy Robbins, Robert Daws and Sarah Beck Mather star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Katie tells Viv what her daughter has been up to, but her malicious actions backfire when Andy lets Donna and Robert move in. Val steps up her campaign to seduce Danny and Chas falls foul of another employer

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val is thrilled to be torn between two would-be lovers, while Terry celebrates his first wedding anniversary, but how long can Dawn keep her illicit feelings for Scott under wraps?

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les hits rock bottom as he faces up to a stretch behind bars, Curly and Emma try to sort out their marital problems and Karen helps forge Mike's signature on bogus company cheques

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A guilt-stricken Karen begins to get cold feet after Mike discusses leaving Underworld to his son, and Les has hope when a homeless man who witnessed the attack comes forward

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A local gigolo is murdered, forcing Jack to face the uncomfortable fact that some women are willing to pay for sex - and triggering an investigation that takes him into the seedy world of male escorts and their clientele. David Jason stars as the old-fashioned copper, with Isla Blair, Russell Hunter, Joanna David and Martin Jarvis

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Colonel and Joan Maltravers host a dinner party to celebrate their son's return from Kenya but the meal is disrupted by an armed robbery. David gives chase to the thief and becomes a local hero - much to the exasperation of Bernie. Liz has a difficult decision to make after receiving an exciting offer from Ben. Guest starring Simon Williams, his wife Lucy Fleming and their son Tam Williams

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate the murder of an ex-army recluse and archaeological enthusiast and suspect a building dispute could provide a motive, while Dennis asks Liz for advice when he begins to notice a change in Jenny's behaviour. Vernon decides to play Cupid on behalf of his relative Gareth and sets him up on a blind date with Rosie, but does not count on the mechanic having another admirer. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Aislin McGuckin and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival, the unveiling of a newly discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime writer George Summersbee is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and local artist Suzie Colebrooke is electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new father Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer? With Fiona Dolman, Tamzin Malleson, Liberty Mills, Una Stubbs and Georgia Taylor

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The team tries to juggle three cases over the course of one day, beginning at 6am when Brooks and Casey are called to a crime scene where a barman has been shot dead in his car. Then, a family dispute leads to murder, and the frenetic morning takes an unexpected turn when an allegation of police intimidation is made against one of the officers. Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls star

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: With their victim identified, Cassie and Sunny begin to find out a bit more about David Walker by talking to his ex-wife, DI Tessa Nixon, who reveals he suffered from depression. A search through the original investigation files and some numbers from David's pager help build a picture of him - and also lead to a few potential suspects. However, his son Jason struggles to deal with the news that someone murdered his dad. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Nigel Lindsay and Will Brown

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer tracks down some of the most endangered animals on the planet in their natural habitats, starting with orangutans in the rainforests of Borneo. Deforestation and poaching have halved the apes' population in the last 60 years, and they're in serious danger of becoming extinct. In the company of indigenous guides and naturalists, he gets a better understanding of how they are surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change.
