programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: At Weymouth beach, Mark Anderson puts the finishing touches to his latest sculpture made entirely of sand, a Coronation scene featuring King Charles complete with crown. Cameras also follow oyster farmer Charlie Bloxham at Fleet Lagoon, who supplies oysters to his father Nigel's popular seafood restaurant

programme.title: TK Maxx: How Do They Really Do It?
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the department store, revealing how they keep their products so cheap and make people buy more. Contributors include Grace Dent and Harry Wallop, TK Maxx buyers, store managers, consumer writers and super-fans

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Faced with a summer travelling to various DJing gigs across the country, fashion stylist and motorhoming novice Gok Wan tries out a luxury vehicle for the day. He's not a fan of the countryside, but fortunately older brother and campervan owner Kwoklyn has joined him for a little moral support. Could Gok become a convert?

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS
programme.desc: An around-the-UK rowing boat challenge goes disastrously wrong off the Mull of Kintyre as horrendous weather puts five rowers' lives in jeopardy. The search and rescue Helicopter crew at Prestwick are tasked with locating and saving the stranded and isolated competitors in the pitch black, as the boat edges closer to an area of treacherous rocks

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: The return after a break of the documentary following Derbyshire police on duty between 9pm and 10pm. After a two-day manhunt, officers finally track down a man suspected of carrying out a series of terrifying armed robberies, but they face a race against time to secure the evidence needed to charge him

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: On Anglesey, PC Mark Lee fights for his life after a driver deliberately runs him down and leaves him for dead, while a Wiltshire officer tries to persuade a violent man to hand over his distressed baby. In Liverpool, a terrified officer issues an urgent call for help while hanging out of the passenger side of his own police car - the result of a criminal in handcuffs stealing trying to use it as a getaway vehicle

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Pratyush prepares himself for what he hopes will be a life-changing surgery for a fast-growing tumour pressing on his brain stem, threatening his hearing and making it difficult for him to walk. If surgeons don't operate soon, his tumour could potentially push him into a coma, before ultimately killing him. Cameras also focus on Mariella, who needs a ground-breaking procedure for a recurring bowel cancer

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: Rob Bell tells the dramatic story of Second World War aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, which hunted down some of Nazi Germany's most feared warships

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Peter Wright gets an emergency call from sheep farmer Clive, whose ewe has gone into labour, but the lambs are tangled up inside their mother. One arrives safely but the second isn't breathing, and Peter's skills are put to the test when he realises there is a third lamb still to come. In Boroughbridge, Julian and Anne operate on a dog with a tumour in its chest

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Liverpool cathedral is the Church of England's newest cathedral, and the largest in Britain. It was designed in the Gothic style by Giles Gilbert Scott, who also designed the red telephone box. It took 74 years to build and was paid for by money donated from the people of Liverpool. National tragedies such as the sinking of the Titanic - many of whose crew came from Liverpool - and the Hillsborough football disaster are remembered within its walls. It is also where Paul McCartney composed and performed his first classical piece of music, the Liverpool Oratorio

In Radford, knife-crime team officers track down a vehicle suspected of being involved in drug dealing, but the driver manages to give them the slip and Ken receives an earful from the irate passenger

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Child Snatcher: Manhunt
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary telling the story of one of the UK's largest murder investigations, with police hunting for a serial killer who abducted and murdered Jennifer Cardy, Susan Maxwell, Caroline Hogg and Sarah Harper in the 1980s. Detectives from multiple forces attempted to join the dots between the murders using antiquated policing systems, but without vehicle registration recognition, CCTV or even fully-fledged computer systems, could they close the net before the killer struck again?

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: Documentary following joint police and paramedic fast response units, with both emergency services travelling together in one high-performance vehicle. In the first episode, units respond to a car rolling in the middle of a residential area, a stabbing in the victim's own home, and a man who has fallen and is unable to move in the middle of an 80-acre nature reserve

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Trauma team leader Julie Norton battles to save two patients whose lives hang in the balance. Father of four Ian is rushed in after suffering a cardiac arrest, while another man is bleeding so heavily he risks losing his entire circulatory system. Meanwhile, Ken has fallen from a roof onto a skip, leaving him with a gaping wound to his thigh and potentially life-threatening injuries to his pelvis and spine, and Dr Nayak helps Michael, who has suffered a severe stroke

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers arrive at a property on the hunt for a suspected drugs dealer who has been on the run for two years, and are forced to smash a window to gain entry, while a 45-mile cross-border pursuit of a black Lexus is brought to a stop with a little help from a stinger. In Nottingham, the knife crime team arrests a suspected drug dealer, caught red-handed with what appears to be cocaine and heroin in his pants

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Fiona Phillips examines the changing fortunes of the supermarket chain, which has lost its position at the top of the business in recent years, squeezed between upmarket rivals and discount stores offering lower prices. The programme features contributions from employees, customers and financial experts, and examines the challenges in dominating the middle market and attempting to be competitive on both price and quality

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Mosque
programme.desc: Meera Syal narrates a documentary going behind the scenes at the Baitul Futuh mosque in Morden, south London, home to Britain's 30,000-strong Ahmadi Muslim community. The film reveals the defining moments of life at the mosque, from finding love to committing to faith as well as looking at international celebrations and a tragedy that devastates the entire community

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme meets a dog with severe separation anxiety and attachment issues, but he soon learns there is a powerful reason for this inseparable bond between dog and owner. Elsewhere, Graeme meets Danielle and Paul, a couple who are unable to enjoy walking their two dogs in the countryside as one of their dogs constantly yaps at any other animals she sees

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: A frog called Kermit has a very delicate problem at his rear end. But he's so slippery and jumpy, it's Matt who's feeling like the Muppet. Julian operates on a cat with a strange lump, while two of the vet's farming friends head to the practice with a ewe who's struggling to give birth to large twin lambs

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Child Snatcher: Manhunt
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part documentary about the investigation into serial killer Robert Black. Police believe they have their strongest suspect to date into the murders of several young girls across Great Britain, but he is refusing to talk. And with a lack of physical and forensic evidence, detectives face one of the biggest challenges of their careers. Can they prove that Black is responsible for the vicious murders of girls as young as five years old?

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2005 murder of 18-year-old model Sally Anne Bowman, who was sexually abused and repeatedly stabbed in her driveway in Croydon, south London. The convicted assailant, chef Mark Dixie, had denied the crime, claiming he stumbled across her body and engaged in sex before realising she was dead

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: Inspector Anton Sullivan is on the hunt for an escaped prisoner who is believed to be a high risk to the public, with a drone and dog handlers helping in the search. Anton is then called to a serious collision on the M56 involving a motorcyclist and multiple vehicles, while PC Niaz Waddington deals with boy racers who are weaving through traffic and speeding on the motorway

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Police from Derbyshire are on a campaign to round up wanted criminals on the run, and officer Matt Copestake joins a high-speed pursuit of a man wanted across two counties. North of Chesterfield, Andy Swift receives intel on the whereabouts of car linked to a wanted suspect, and units from across the county close in on the suspect car and its occupants

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: World's Most Luxurious Private Jets
programme.desc: Luxury travel blogger Em Sheldon catches a flight on one of the most extravagant private jets in the world, which cost more than £80m to build and kit out. The cabin of this jet was designed by leading international designer Edese Doret, who was famously asked to create designs for the US President's aircraft Air Force One, and the blinds, music and cabin temperature can be controlled from iPads tucked into each seat

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: Documentary about people who have undergone extreme cosmetic surgery to achieve their ideal appearance. The first episode focuses on three women who have tried to turn themselves into Barbie dolls, including a woman who has spent 11 years transforming herself and is now about to begin a new relationship

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: When Merlin the stealth engine comes to Sodor from the mainland for the first time, Percy is determined to see this 'invisible' engine

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Carlos and Tracker get stranded on an island in the search for buried treasure

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania (2012)
programme.desc: Dracula opens a luxury resort for monsters, to provide a refuge from terrified humans. His cosy sanctuary is disrupted when a normal man unwittingly checks in, and the situation is complicated when the unwanted guest takes a liking to the count's daughter. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2 (2015)
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his son's tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation (2018)
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Rat Race (2001)
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Underwater (2020)
programme.desc: Nora Price is a mechanical engineer at the Kepler drilling station, seven miles beneath the surface of the Pacific Ocean. She and a small crew fight for survival after a tremor causes catastrophic failures to the base's integrity. Meanwhile, in the inky void, something unspeakable lurks, waiting to attack. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kristen Stewart, Mamoudou Athie and Vincent Cassell

programme.title: The Shape of Water (2017)
programme.desc: Elisa Esposito is a mute singleton who lives above a cinema. Although friends with Giles, a neighbouring artist, she lives a lonely existence. While he has designs on the cafe worker nearby, Elisa cleans up at top-secret government lab, a bus ride away in Baltimore, Maryland. One day in 1962, she makes a life-changing discovery when Elisa finds an amphibious humanoid creature who is being held captive, and they embark on an extraordinary relationship. Guillermo del Toro's Oscar and Bafta-winning fantasy, starring Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Octavia Spencer and Doug Jones

programme.title: Sign2Win
programme.desc: BSL Zone's first deaf gameshow. Three teams have their BSL language and deaf cultural knowledge tested with a prize of £1000 going to the winner

programme.title: Sign2Win
programme.desc: BSL Zone's first deaf gameshow. Three teams have their BSL language and deaf cultural knowledge tested with a prize of £1000 going to the winner

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Leap Year (2010)
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017)
programme.desc: Four teenagers play a jungle-themed game on an old console, only to find themselves transported into the game and transformed into its heroic characters. They must embark on a death-defying journey through the game's wilderness setting to make it back to the real world, or be stuck as video game characters forever. Fantasy action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service (2015)
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster turn out to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Funny Cow (2018)
programme.desc: A stand-up comedian fights for success on the brutally unforgiving working men's club scene of 1970s northern England. Drama, starring Maxine Peake, Stephen Graham, Paddy Considine and Tony Pitts, who also wrote the screenplay

programme.title: Megamind (2010)
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Dad's Army (1971)
programme.desc: The ragtag soldiers of the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard are given the chance to prove their mettle by apprehending three German aviators who have parachuted into the country in the vanguard of a suspected Nazi invasion. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses (2016)
programme.desc: A suburban couple become embroiled in an international espionage plot when they discover that their seemingly perfect new neighbours are actually government spies. Action comedy, starring Zach Galifianakis, Isla Fisher, Jon Hamm and Gal Gadot

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level (2019)
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the world's most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdan's fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: Somers Town (2008)
programme.desc: Troubled youngster Tommo runs away to London where he meets Marek, a shy Polish immigrant who lives with his labourer father in run-down Somers Town. Tommo moves into their small flat, and the pair end up doing odd jobs for an eccentric neighbour and competing for the attention of a French waitress - while trying to keep their escapades a secret from Marek's father. Shane Meadows' comedy drama, starring Thomas Turgoose, Piotr Jagiello and Ireneusz Czop

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Leela holds an intervention for Donna-Marie, the shared house is torn apart after Rayne's accusation against Prince and John Paul warns Hunter about getting too close to a pupil

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Featuring an attempt to get dressed on a treadmill, a vending machine, a fall into a river and a penalty kick back

programme.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold (2019)
programme.desc: Having spent most of her life exploring the jungle with her parents, nothing could prepare Dora for her most dangerous adventure ever - high school. Always the explorer, Dora quickly finds herself leading Boots (her best friend, a monkey), Diego, a mysterious jungle inhabitant and a rag tag group of teens on a live-action adventure to save her parents and solve the impossible mystery behind a lost city of gold. Live-action adaptation of the hit animated kids' show, starring Isabela Moner, Eva Longoria and Jeff Wahlberg

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Greek at the Harbour restaurant in southern California, where owner Makis Mikelatos works 17 hours a day, seven days a week, but is unwilling to let his son Ari take the reins. Gordon sets out to get to the bottom of Makis's reluctance to teach his son, and uncovers a shocking family secret

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon start a gossip experiment to see how quickly rumours spread among the gang, while Howard tells his friends he is planning to propose to Bernadette - not realising Raj is wrestling with his own feelings for her. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard decides to tell his mother that he and Bernadette are engaged - but she later collapses, making him fear the shock of the news has caused her to suffer a heart attack. As the gang convenes at the hospital, Sheldon's fear of infectious diseases lands him in trouble, while Priya and Penny bond over coffee

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway, Candice Bergen and Chris Pratt

programme.desc: Sheffield architects Howard Evans and Prue Chiles set out to transform Mandy's 1980s redbrick house, which stands out like a sore thumb among the grand Victorian properties it sits alongside on Nottingham's prestigious Park Estate. The duo are familiar with unlocking the potential of buildings, but this could be their biggest challenge yet

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George gets to celebrate one of his favourite periods of British architecture when he helps out at an arts and crafts Edwardian terrace house in Addiscombe, south London. Cookie and Sophia bought their home six months ago, but, despite it being full to the brim with amazing original features, from fireplaces to balustrades and stained-glass windows, it needed some serious TLC. This renovation is a labour of love as the couple set about painstakingly restoring the features by themselves. George visits the wallpaper library of his all-time design hero William Morris, and tries his hand at block printing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. The guests he is hoping to impress are 23-year-old fitness fanatic Toria, 44-year-old property developer Christine, 40-year-old South African business woman Sam, and 20-year-old student Inzy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B competition heads to France as four British expats compete, beginning with Lisanne Ashton, who runs the rural Les Chimeres in the south of the country. After searching for truffles in the surrounding area, guest Tony Horton's passion for the royal family causes him to clash with fellow competitor Shaun Baggs, whose mood is worsened by the discovery of bugs in his bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Le Manoir in the Dordogne, owned by royalist Tony Horton and his Armenian wife Shou Shou - who make a poor first impression by presenting guests with a timetable specifying when they are allowed to use the bathroom. A vinegar-tasting session also receives a tepid response, and some of the visitors are bemused by their hosts turning up for breakfast in costume

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wine-loving Shaun Baggs and his partner Patrick Weaver bring the contest to Le Clos Rabelais in central France, where they invite fellow competitors to take part in a traditional French dance class. Tension mounts as George and Linda become increasingly frustrated with Lisanne, and the bickering continues over dinner when Shaun is confronted about his previous negative feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first host in Bournemouth, 38-year-old bar manager and musician Adie, hopes to hit the right notes by ensuring his night of laid back fun is full of music and laughter. With trumpets and drums at the ready and tricky crustaceans proving hard to crack, does Adie have what it takes to win the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second Bournemouth host is aristocratic vet Sir Henry, who plans to charm his way to the prize by hosting an evening of relaxed dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Countryside-loving Pippa from Bournemouth hopes to impress her guests by throwing a dinner party with every course inspired by fish

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bournemouth, spiritual student Simone hopes to wow her guests with a spicy Bajan menu. She's keen to impress her new friend, posh vet Sir Henry, but she's unsure about Pippa, who doesn't hold back as she probes Simone about her student house

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the last night in Bournemouth, flamboyant charity manager Jacqueline hopes that Michelin star-style food will win her the prize. programme.title: PopMaster TV

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya and nurse Ebony brace themselves as paramedics bring in a man who's been on a two-day drug bender. Dr Emma calls in back-up to save a mum clinging onto life

Claire has a change of heart and asks Jared to stay, but he tells her they will both be happy apart

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya and nurse Ebony brace themselves as paramedics bring in a man who's been on a two-day drug bender. Dr Emma calls in back-up to save a mum clinging onto life

Meanwhile, a 12-year-old translates for his Brazilian grandmother and a five-year-old has her head wound stitched

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Sharron Davies and Tanni Grey-Thompson face the stopwatch once more as they battle to complete personalised slogan banners

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: In the medieval towns of south-west France, an ale lover tries to persuade the wine-loving French to drink British beer, a chef and his partner launches a new restaurant and a former shoe designer finishes off a renovation project started by her late father. Fred Sirieix narrates

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team heads to Sue's house in Tiverton, Devon, finding a moped that brings back memories, and fighting over a petrol gauge that Simon O'Brien wants to upcycle into a clock

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The story of how name changes in a Jewish family tested the research skills of the probate detectives, and ultimately led to an emotional family reunion. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers search for the relatives of a Northamptonshire man who left a will that was discovered to be invalid. They also visit one of the beneficiaries of a £65,000 estate, and reveal some information about his ancestor's life in India

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owner Helen Marriott offers her guest a chance to 'step off the planet' and treats them to essential breathing lessons, a chance to get to know one another in the hot tub, and soul-soothing foot massages at the Fountains Court Holistic Health Hotel in the North Yorkshire resort of Scarborough

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to the Whittington & Cat, a pub in Hull that also offers B&B. Proprietor Sue Perkins treats her guests to an afternoon of ice hockey, but they are intrigued by the possible contents of her peculiarly titled breakfast menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Dagmar the giraffe is supporting her closest herd member Orla, whose new calf is overdue - but at the same time she is reluctant to allow her own youngest to feed properly. So the keepers plan a herd birth in the hope that both mothers can learn from each other. There is concern when two of the spider monkeys withdraw from their family, while two devoted camels experience the trauma of separation when one undergoes an operation

Creating this life changing vision on a £530k budget, and in only eight months, will not be an easy task, especially as they must build up close to an ancient oak without destroying any of the roots

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates the unclaimed estate of a Nottinghamshire woman, but are unsure of its value, and another search reveals the fascinating story of working life on Britain's waterways. Plus, details of more unclaimed windfalls

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining how Hitler and the Nazi party rose to power in Germany during the 1930s, revealing the greed, manipulation and frightening underestimation of Adolf Hitler's ambition. In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. Leading historians and experts take viewers inside the minds of those hellbent on gaining power and those who tried to stop them

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England by celebrating Victorian trade with the Preston Guild, and then heading to Rochdale to learn about a pioneering movement to improve the lives of working families. The presenter also follows in the tracks of many 19th-century industrial employees who made day trips to Hebden Bridge to walk in the Calder Valley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Leeds by travelling through Buckinghamshire, meeting one of the Second World War's most secret agents at Bletchley. In Olney, he learns about a poet whose words are still sung today, and explores the first purpose-built railway town at Wolverton. His last stop is Newport Pagnell, where he tackles the ancient craft of vellum-making

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from London to Leeds begins in Northampton, where Victorian methods have been used to make shoes for more than 130 years. The ex-politician then heads to Warwickshire, learning about the legacy of Dr Thomas Arnold at Rugby School and finding out how Coventry's craftsmen learned to adapt to survive, before ending this leg of his trip in Nuneaton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Leeds, Michael Portillo sets off in Leicester, where he finds out about the hunt for Richard III's remains. Michael works his passage on the Great Central Railway from Rothley to Loughborough, where he learns about a family that has been casting bells in the town since 1839

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent from Kamloops to the spa resort of Banff. This magnificent journey takes him to the highest point of the 19th century transcontinental Canadian Pacific Railway line at Kicking Horse Pass, past Lake Louise and inside spiral tunnels blasted through the mountains. Along the way, Michael hears of the harsh and dangerous conditions endured by the Chinese and European labourers who built the railway, and looks back at the historic driving of the Last Spike, which completed the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1885

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Ceri and Mike Green both work for the Lincolnshire Fire Service, but with retirement approaching, they want to move to the mountains. Ceri feels a strong pull towards the Lake District, where they spent their honeymoon, but Mike dreams of living in the French Alps, where he's been on skiing holidays with friends. Jonnie Irwin shows them three properties in the UK for their budget of £435,000, while Laura Hamilton shows them three in the Alps for their £415,000 French budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newly married Brian and Wendy Woods from Somerset are looking to buy their dream home on the beautiful island of Tenerife. Brian has been holidaying in the canaries for over 30 years, and since he met Wendy 10 years ago the couple have been dreaming about relocating to their favourite island permanently. Armed with a budget of £180,000 Laura Hamilton locates five properties from them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lian and Dave are searching for a holiday home in Spain's Almería Province to enjoy with their 13-year-old son Dominic. Ben Hillman lines up five impressive properties for their £80,000 budget, but will any of them be the perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Nick and Natalie Hammond are selling their family home in Hertfordshire and want to buy somewhere near the coast with more outdoor space for their four children. Nick's keen on a move to Mallorca, having holidayed in Spain as a child, but Natalie would prefer to move to Cornwall. They have a cash budget of £275,000 if they buy in Majorca where Laura Hamilton is on hand to help, or £375,000 if they buy in Cornwall, where Jonnie Irwin tries to beat Laura's properties

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Danni Menzies arrives in the beautiful coastal town of Nerja in southern Spain to meet house-hunter Frances, who is dreaming of buying a holiday home she can enjoy with her friends and family. With her daughter Karina also on hand to lend her support, Frances would love to find a two-bed property close to the sea, so Danni sets out to deliver her dream within a budget of £200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Bella seems to warm to Jay, but it's Roshni who has the final say. Olivia the blind spaniel is looking for a home and funeral workers Amy and Alex want to rescue a dog in need

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has been stabbed in the leg and the head, only to discover he had already overdosed on heroin prior to receiving his injuries. Paramedics also treat a man struggling to breathe after a triple heart bypass operation, a woman whose rare genetic condition causes her to have seizures, and a man with severe chest pains who has recently had treatment for a heart complaint

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Wilderness survival challenge in which 11 people must battle the elements in the remote wilderness of northwest Canada, equipped with only a handful of basic tools to win £100,000. At the start of the journey, they face the first signs of bears and wolves, and race to put up shelters and light fires before the sun sets, leaving them in the pitch-black night with only the sounds of the wilderness for company

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest A&E departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. An infrared drone kit is used to search for a teenager who hasn't been seen since climbing a scaffolding around a nightclub in Birmingham. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer tracks down some of the most endangered animals on the planet in their natural habitats, starting with orangutans in the rainforests of Borneo. Deforestation and poaching have halved the apes' population in the last 60 years, and they're in serious danger of becoming extinct. In the company of indigenous guides and naturalists, he gets a better understanding of how they are surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change.

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: The trainers give advice to Melissa, whose labrador-cross Milo is running rings around her and makes a dash for it every time she calls his name. Two-year old zuchon Archie is aggressive to strangers and has begun to bite, and mother and daughter owners Kirsty and Katie are desperate to end hiss reign of terror before it gets any worse

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination is North Kingsfield Holiday Cottages in East Yorkshire, where a revelation over evening drinks leaves the guests all at sea

programme.desc: Deb Croghan hosts the third dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, and hopes to impress her guests with a tarts and vicars-style evening. Following an uncomfortable game of guessing everyone's age, she perks up the evening with an unusual entertainment - a cucumber-based sport she claims is a traditional family pastime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old hot-tub salesman John Mabey hosts the fourth dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, setting out to woo his guests with a Shakespearean evening featuring an Italian-style menu, but when his food comes close to a complete fiasco, he turns to theatrics to save the day - including asking his guests to act out Romeo and Juliet

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Martin Young hosts the final dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress his guests by throwing a Caribbean-themed evening. The diners are pleasantly surprised by the quality of his food and shocked when he reveals a secret talent, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After successfully selling British beer in France, two brewers from Kent pitch another English craze to the French. Cameras revisit to monitor the degree of their success. Plus, the outdoor adventure company in Majorca, whose owner took a leap into the unknown to secure her future on the island

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Celia Thompson has long dreamed of running an arts and crafts business in the Carcassonne area of France. However, her partner Nick Hares is hesitant about leaving the UK, as his teenage daughters live near Cambridge. He'd rather move to the Waveney Valley, on the border of Suffolk and Norfolk. Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help the couple solve their dilemma

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps a couple who have been living abroad choose between properties in Oxford or Javea, in Spain. Steve hopes to settle back in his native Britain where his French wife Caroline can indulge in her love of culture, but she has her sights set on the Costa Blanca

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Father-and-son team Steve and Shaun Garner help animal lovers Steve and Heidi Hood find a home that could also serve as a bed-and-breakfast

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This contest takes place in and around Sheffield. The first host is 50-year-old chocolate shop manager Ginnette; a self-confessed party girl who hopes to impress her guests with a menu of fun family favourites, including beef stroganoff and banana pudding, a party atmosphere and surprise entertainment. Her guests are emergency services worker Josh, wellness coach Andy, GP surgery manager Clare and psychologist Abi

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second host in Sheffield is emergency services worker Josh, who entertains his guests with life drawing - but a furry find during the arrival drinks divides opinion

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: GP surgery manager Clare hosts the third dinner party of the week in and around Sheffield, hoping to impress her guests with a 'winter warmer' menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wellness coach Andy is the fourth host in and around Sheffield. He hopes to impress his guests with a tasty and healthy meal - and livens up the proceedings with his singing skills

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host in and around Sheffield is 37-year-old psychologist Abi, who hopes to win her guests over with a menu inspired by her travels through Asia. There's an impromptu lesson in sock puppetry, which is both a hit and miss with the group, while a burning hot chilli sauce and some supermarket-bought fish proves cause for controversy with a competitive bunch who are ready to pounce on any missteps

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lian and Dave are searching for a holiday home in Spain's Almería Province to enjoy with their 13-year-old son Dominic. Ben Hillman lines up five impressive properties for their £80,000 budget, but will any of them be the perfect place?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: In Weston-super-Mare, George meets some novice DIY renovators who are planning to completely transform a dilapidated Georgian-style crescent house, poorly sub-divided into four flats in the 1980s. With a budget of just £40,000, no building experience and a plan to live onsite with two young children, the stakes could not be higher for this family

programme.title: Millionaire Hoarders
programme.desc: Experts sift through homes crammed with potential treasure to unearth prized items that could raise life-changing sums of cash. The first episode features Simon and Adity, who quit their city jobs to take on Simon's family home - a 700-year-old castle in Scotland. They've called in the experts to raise cash from the property's vast collection of antiques, manuscripts and paintings

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Wilderness survival challenge in which 11 people must battle the elements in the remote wilderness of northwest Canada, equipped with only a handful of basic tools to win £100,000. At the start of the journey, they face the first signs of bears and wolves, and race to put up shelters and light fires before the sun sets, leaving them in the pitch-black night with only the sounds of the wilderness for company

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Strictly Come Dancing, Coronation Street, Antiques Roadshow, Frozen Planet II, Kings of Pain, Help! My House Is Haunted, Only Connect, and ITV News coverage of the mini-budget

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. An infrared drone kit is used to search for a teenager who hasn't been seen since climbing a scaffolding around a nightclub in Birmingham. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: 21 year-old Connor is rushed in after a motorbike accident leaving him with leg and lung injuries. 69 year-old Rob with locked-in-syndrome is admitted into Resus after his breathing tube becomes dislodged leaving him unable to breathe properly. In minor injuries 58 year-old Lisa receives treatment for an injured wrist

programme.title: Confessions of a Cam Girl
programme.desc: Part two of two. Two cam performers consider teaming up, hoping to improve their income as well as relieve some of the loneliness that comes with the profession. In Liverpool, Layla began camming six years ago and has carved a hugely successful career from being a plus-sized model. Since coming out as polyamorous two years ago, Layla is now ready to get out there and find partners

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Maine Coon cat is brought into the practice with a fractured hip joint, which Noel determines is caused by a genetic disease that has made the heads of both of her femur bones degenerate. After a very challenging process of weighing up the pros and cons of surgery, the owners opt for bilateral total hip replacement.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Memorable moments of the year, featuring some of the country's favourite celebrities critiquing TV shows that they have watched. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Clair Sherwood-Parkin hosts the first party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping to impress with a Moroccan-inspired feast. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon James Emson hosts the second party in Darlington, Co Durham, and decides to accompany his curry main course with a gruesome contest in which he serves up a selection of eyeballs, tongues and other bits of offal, then challenges his guests to identify which animal they came from. Diner Barry l'Anson also manages to leave the party having achieved a lifetime ambition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barry I'Anson hosts the third dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and hopes his love-themed evening will endear him to his guests. Unfortunately for him Clair Sherwood-Parkin is not impressed and begins doubting the host's masculinity, and vet James Emson is concerned what the dessert will be like. Charlotte Langley finds herself wanting a sick bag before the evening is over, and Eseyoma Sodje steals the show during some cringe-worthy entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charlotte Langley hosts the fourth dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and asks her guests to attend dressed as their favourite red-carpet celebrity, but as the night progresses, she discovers she is not very good at taking criticism and a tense situation threatens to get out of hand

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eseyoma Sodje hosts the final dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping her Nigerian recipes and a hint of glamour will impress her guests. To further improve her chances of bagging the £1,000 prize, she puts on a round of hip-hop karaoke, before the winner is announced

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A couple in Mallorca look at ways to diversify and keep their restaurant at the top spot. Plus, catching up with B&B owners in France to see if they are still living the dream

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Karin Lorenz would love to start a new life in south-western France. She wants to find the right house, with scope to run a self-catering business, so she can get it underway before moving there. However, her partner Mike Griffin would prefer to live in Pembrokeshire. Whichever destination they plump for, Karin's mother is set to move with them - as will their two dogs. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin show the pair some tempting properties

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help Richard, who wants a home in Devon, where he can stay close to his family, friends and football team. However, his partner Jackie wants a property in Cartagena, southern Spain with a garden she can tend

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Newlyweds with a love of dancing hunt for a home in Almeria, while in Alicante, a Liverpudlian couple want a house with plenty of outside space for the husband's potted plants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five cooks compete for the £1,000 prize in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and keen basketball player Ken Oputa is the first to host, inviting his guests to turn up in sportswear fancy dress. He hopes his Double Dribble mushrooms and Slam Dunk salmon will prove to be winning ingredients

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. After dinner, he entertains his guests with a bucking bronco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth helps Liz and Ian find their dream holiday home in the Mani Peninsula in Greece on budget of £280,000

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer tracks down some of the most endangered animals on the planet in their natural habitats, starting with orangutans in the rainforests of Borneo. Deforestation and poaching have halved the apes' population in the last 60 years, and they're in serious danger of becoming extinct. In the company of indigenous guides and naturalists, he gets a better understanding of how they are surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change.

programme.title: The Supervet

After a very challenging process of weighing up the pros and cons of surgery, the owners opt for bilateral total hip replacement.

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to reports of a man collapsed in the street and in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, he's surrounded by police officers who've been carrying out CPR. In other cases, a woman in severe abdominal pain has a panic attack as the paramedics try to get her breathing under control, while a man with a fast heart rate is vomiting blood

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the family-run Gloucester Service Station in the Cotswolds. This first episode visits the only cheesemaker in the world who uses milk from Gloucester rare-breed cows. This episode also explores Gloucester Services' close association with the local community

programme.desc: The rivals arrive at the Domo Boutique Hotel in Oldbury near Birmingham, where owner Ali expects his luxury lodgings to wow his fellow competitors. Helen and Lauren are dazzled by the decor, but a caffeine conundrum leads to some trouble brewing

programme.desc: An eviction specialist helps a landlord with a particularly aggressive pair of tenants, while a missing door leads to the discovery of a thief stealing electricity. Two landlords struggle with a rent agreement, and another deals with a trash-slinging tenant

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: An English teacher finally manages to get rid of an aggressive tenant and move back in, but at a terrible cost. A landlord who evicted a squatter follows up with her to see her new life, while a letting agent finds success after kicking out destructive tenants.

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Paul Shamplina helps landlord David Coppen evict a tenant who has been upsetting the neighbours, while letting agent Paul Ainsworth Lord confronts a volatile tenant who has been keeping terrapins in his bath, as well as chasing a guarantor for rent arrears from tenants in a flea-infested flat. In Wigan, letting agents Karen O'Connor and Gemma Painter from Lobster Lettings discover a house trashed and abandoned.

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Catching up with a landlord two years after he got his property back from a troublesome tenant who refused to leave the property without a fight. Lawyer Chris Sharp helps two Ghanaian ministers, Reverend Sarpong and Ibrahim Farook, get back their 18th century church in the heart of Liverpool so they can launch a ministry and community centre there

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Letting agent Paul has a tenant in Lancashire who is behind with his rent and won't return any calls, but the situation is much worse than he could possibly have imagined when he heads into the upstairs bedroom. Harrow enforcement officers Andrew and Ozge are called to a local salon, where a leak from the upstairs flat is disrupting Masi's ability to run her shop. Once the landlord agrees to give them access, they discover terrible conditions and a back yard piled with rubbish

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Paul is called to a domestic incident in which an elderly woman has allegedly stabbed her husband with a meat cleaver, while a mysterious traffic incident sees a car upside down and on fire, the driver missing and a baby seat in the back. Plus, a drunken disturbance in a pub leads to a tense manhunt through dark countryside

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: While targeting cross-border thieves and fraudsters, officers are on the hunt for a car suspected of being used in supermarket thefts in a neighbouring county, while another intelligence-led operation identifies a car that is thought to be linked to drug dealing in North Yorkshire. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are called to a serious accident near Skipton involving a motorbike, while a group of bikers get into an altercation with a motorist on the road to Harrogate, allegedly forcing him off the road and assaulting him. At the start of the Easter weekend, a rider loses control in a potentially fatal accident and a collision investigation unit is called to the scene

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. On the southern border of North Yorkshire, some more youngsters catch the eye of the traffic cops when it appears the driver is using a mobile phone. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. The police conduct a raid on a house near York, on the hunt for a suspected drug dealer, while a routine patrol takes a sinister turn when a man in a bar is spotted with a knife

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A drink-driver damages one of the team's favourite cars, and Kevin hunts down a horsebox full of illegal plants. Elsewhere, officers are led on a chase across the countryside, Nick and Dee offer an insight into Taser tactics, and a very important visitor arrives in Chesterfield

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jason heads to a Christmas party that has turned into a full-blown riot, while Adam and Nick catch a drunken woman giving her daughter a lift to the shops. Plus, Kev is seconds away from disaster when he places himself in the path of danger to prevent a car from becoming a fireball

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A runaway suspect puts Gary's life in danger, Scott and Adam discover a huge stash of drugs in the boot of a car, and officers are called to a New Year's Eve pub brawl. Plus, Ady catches a car thief, and five police vehicles are involved in a motorway chase

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Scott and Dave use GPS technology to track a pair of mobile-phone thieves, and a car crashes into a house during the Christmas period. Plus, Nick pursues a criminal gang, Vicky deals with a van containing suspicious-looking scrap, and Jason contends with his own traffic nightmare

programme.title: Non-Stop (2014)

The house is in terrible shape, but the young tenants promise they will clear it all up and keep the noise down. Instead, however, the partying gets worse, with some of the tenants' 'associates' making nasty threats

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Sgt Matt heads a team in pursuit of a teenage driver transporting stolen goods in a 7.5-ton truck, with the desperate youth ramming three police cars, almost running over an officer, and driving the wrong way up a dual carriageway before abandoning the vehicle and running off

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: On the M1, Karl responds to a police camera alert on a stolen car that has been linked to a spate of burglaries, while controllers receive a 999 call from a man reporting that his car has just been stolen from his driveway. A report of a suspected stolen Range Rover takes a dramatic twist when the police arrest the suspect, who claims he had been kidnapped by the owner of the car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jon puts his body on the line as he tackles a drunken youth in a domestic dispute and Martin turns detective to catch a drink-driver who thinks she can get one over on the interceptors. A pizza delivery driver take fast food to the extreme, Doug gets to grips with a burglar and the hunt is on for Lincoln's answer to Harry Houdini

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sgt Carlin arrests a gang of van thieves and uncovers a major criminal operation in the process, while a late-night compost thief is caught on his way out of the shower. Officers hunt for a trucker wielding a baseball bat who has apparently succumbed to road rage and vegetarian Craggy rides to the rescue of a lorry load of calves on the A46. Elsewhere, Brian cracks down on a barbaric blood sport, Jon faces an unexploded bomb, and two fuel thieves plough straight into the interceptors' precious BMW

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit are at the forefront of a raid against suspected drug traffickers, the hunt is on for a driver who has fled the scene of a horrific crash, and Rich Precious and Sean Baxter are left lagging far behind as they chase a speeding biker. Dan Brigginshaw is on duty at Spalding's annual flower show, and Sean Brennan deals with a young man who thinks he can throw his weight around after a boozy night out

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Dog trainer Graeme Hall meets Australian labradoodle Doddle, who was intended as a companion for owner Sarah's nine-year-old son. But he is being overbearing with his love, licking the boy's face at every opportunity. On the flipside, he also deals with cockapoo Leia, who loves mum and the kids but hates dad. Can Graeme get these pooches to alter their ways?

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Summer Bay is rocked by disaster. Bree springs into action to save a life, and Kate continues to lean on Xander

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: In the aftermath of her assault, Felicity dodges questions from a concerned Tane. Irene and Marilyn remain at Roo's bedside, where they learn she is not yet breathing on her own

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Ameet Tailor lends his expertise to Daniel, a 20-something self-confessed cannabis addict who has become frustrated by his inability to kick the habit. It is up to Dr Ameet to calm his patient and get him into rehab. Dr David Ward deals with angry Irishman David, who arrives on crutches and with an injured hand following a fight. David is furious with the council, and is taking a distinctly negative approach to life, so the doctor suggests he tackle his problems one at a time. Finally, nurse Sheila Wellavise helps cheerful patient Mario, who almost cut off the end of his finger while using a circular saw while doing a spot of DIY

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It's another busy day for the casualty team with patient numbers unusually high. Sister Rachel is running the shift, and she's under pressure with a shortage of cubicles - to make matters worse, IT systems start to fail across the hospital, causing chaos for patient flow. Urgent treatment is needed for 75-year-old Janet, who's been viciously attacked by a dog and has a large flap of skin hanging from her elbow

programme.title: Murdered for Revenge
programme.desc: The murder of Stephen Whitehead, who was found bludgeoned to death at work, leading police to suspect a burglary had gone wrong. But was the killer in fact a colleague harbouring a deadly grudge?

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The crimes of Bruce McArthur, a church-going family man who for years was hooking-up with and killing gay men, shielded by a camouflage of respectability

programme.title: Robin Hood (2018)
programme.desc: Battle-hardened Crusader Robin of Loxley and his Moorish commander launch an audacious rebellion against the corrupt English crown. However, they face tough competition from the twisted Sheriff of Nottingham. Director Otto Bathurst, who also worked on Peaky Blinders and His Dark Materials, delivers his take on the classic adventure yarn. Taron Egerton plays the heroic outlaw, with Jamie Foxx, Ben Mendelsohn and Tim Minchin also starring

But with only his pension to live on, and his movable mansion in need of a refurb, will he have to sell up?

Harrow housing agents Andrew and Jo find a suspected unlicensed multiple-occupancy house in gross disrepair. After tracking down the landlord, they have mercy and allow him to spend his £5,000 fine on fixing up the property, in the hope he will turn it into a nice family home. But will the he be as good as his word?

programme.desc: On the outskirts of Chesterfield, Jim responds to an urgent call for back-up from his colleague Tom, who is surrounded by an angry mob following a report of a teenager driving dangerously. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Derbyshire team up with neighbouring forces and take the fight to the cross-border criminals under a special initiative dubbed Operation Fuego. John and South Yorkshire officers soon give chase to a getaway driver in a stolen vehicle, which is now on a 120mph rampage on the M18. The stolen vehicle speeds along the hard shoulder on a collision course with a broken-down car. Police try to surround it, but the driver slips through and takes flight on foot. All is not lost however, as a police helicopter keeps tabs on the suspect

Big Jim reports a boy racer to his mum and delivers a dressing down to a driver with a taste for rude gestures

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Jon is forced to wrestle with a drunk man on the high street in Lincoln and Dan has an early morning encounter with a driver who is over the limit. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A violent man gives officers the runaround after wreaking havoc in a hospital, a Macedonian truck driver has a bad day and a fuel thief is caught red-handed. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Gwen is mistaken for Morgana and kidnapped by savage outlaw Hengist, prompting Arthur to defy his father and race into enemy territory to her rescue. However, he finds she is not alone in the abductor's castle - Lancelot is already there. Fantasy drama, starring Angel Coulby, Bradley James and Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The characters in the holodeck-simulated Irish village of Fair Haven become aware of their surroundings, and they are convinced Paris and Kim are evil spirits. Before the pair can repair the malfunction, however, they are captured by the locals, forcing Janeway to enter negotiations for their release. Sci-fi adventure, starring Robert Duncan McNeill and Garrett Wang

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Naval microbiologist whose hobby as a 'myth buster' resulted in his death at the hands of a legendary bayou creature. Agent Hannah Khoury conducts an investigation into previous actions of Deputy Director Van Cleef

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nolan nears the end of his training and faces his biggest challenge as a police officer so far when he must come to terms with the consequences of his actions

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: The gang celebrates Monroe's birthday with a trip, but the break takes a sinister turn when a hotel employee seeks deadly vengeance against Nick

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: Oklahoma detectives must untangle a twisted love triangle to discover the truth after a young man is shot in his own home

programme.title: Killer in My Village
programme.desc: The discovery of two bodies at a home in the Bedfordshire village of Hockliffe and how the subsequent investigation led police to uncover a crime driven by pure greed

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: The dog unit deals with a man who has barricaded himself in his house with his Rottweiler, while a woman thought to have overdosed disappears

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers in Calais search lorries for illegal immigrants, while at Heathrow's Terminal Three a student is prevented from entering the UK after a trip to India

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness the best and worst behaviour on the nation's busiest motorway

programme.desc: Documentary following the work of New Zealand police officers as they try to keep motorists safe on some of the country's most dangerous roads
