programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Fern, a beautiful blue Burmese and one of the Cat Hospital's oldest patients takes a turn for the worse. Franklin, a prize-winning Maine coon, a novice when it comes to females meets Ruby - but will romance ensue? Veterinary specialist Clare Meade meets a visiting cat called Honey

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: David Attenborough's Light on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough embarks on a search for the lights of nature, on a journey that will lead to ocean depths, claustrophobic caves and forests by night

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: This special extended episode shows what goes into the production of London's newest electric taxi

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton begins at Loch Hourn on the mainland, before travelling to Skye, the tiny island of Soay and finishing on Canna. Along the way, he visits the house that was the inspiration for James Bond's home Skyfall, embarks on a nerve-racking caving expedition under the summit of Blaven

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Paul Murton heads to the northern Shetland islands of Fetlar, Unst and Yell, which were once part of Norway. Along the way, he meets the members of a male vocal group who came together to celebrate their Norse heritage, gets a close view of wild otters, and fulfils a longheld ambition to visit Out Stack, the rocky outcrop that is the northernmost point of the British Isles

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.title: Sabotage (1936)
programme.desc: An undercover detective poses as a grocer to get closer to a suspected terrorist thought to be plotting to blow up London. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller based on Joseph Conrad's The Secret Agent, starring Oscar Homolka, Sylvia Sidney, John Loder, Desmond Tester and Joyce Barbour

programme.title: The Passing of the Third Floor Back (1935)
programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: They Were Sisters (1945)
programme.desc: Three sisters marry men of very different character, and face different challenges as their married lives unfold. One remains happy but childless, another suffers cruelty at the hands of her sadistic husband, and the third has a series of affairs to cope with her loveless home life. Drama, with Phyllis Calvert and James Mason

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: The Tabernacle Choir from Temple Square, Music and the Spoken Word, providing music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's top ten choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alphans come into contact with an alien craft, and Maya persuades the crew to help release the prisoner it is carrying. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: The duo infiltrate an organisation for geniuses, and discover their fellow members are being brainwashed by a sinister matron into committing audacious crimes. Light-hearted drama, starring Diana Rigg and Patrick Macnee

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: The story of Helen McCourt, whose family's lives forever changed when her missing persons case turned into a murder investigation. Her body was never found

programme.title: Hound (2017)
programme.desc: An alcoholic loner is snapped out of his misery when his faithful dog is murdered by a local gangster. Overcoming his addiction, he transforms his life by mastering martial arts, then puts his skills to use seeking vengeance. Crime thriller, starring Sacharissa Claxton and Neal Ward

programme.title: Car Trouble (1986)
programme.desc: A sexually unsatisfied woman realises her husband's beloved new car means more to him than her. She has a fling with a salesman that accidentally results in the destruction of the precious vehicle, and consumed by rage, the husband plans a murderous revenge. Comedy, starring Julie Walters, Ian Charleson and Stratford Johns

programme.title: Realm of the Damned (2017)
programme.desc: A lone hero must survive in a world overrun by the supernatural forces of darkness. Animated horror, featuring the voice of David Vincent, Dani Filth and Jill Janus

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: Cassy, Vern and Gus are gifted students who go to an enchanted school to learn about magic. After receiving a book named UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells) they soon begin their journey of a lifetime.

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Rita is grumpy because her GI companions have returned home, and Harvey cannot hold down a job

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: Umbria, the green heart of Italy, is the land that time and tourism forgot. Shaped by geography and politics, the region became a thriving model of creative self-sufficiency

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Phoebe loses patience with Gary's apparent lack of interest in her new film role, and contemplates having a fling to teach him a lesson. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and Elizabeth Carling

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Pigsy is hailed as the new King and God of the Kingdom of the Red Hog, but Tripitaka discovers the current ruler is a demon and Monkey sets out with Sandy to stop him and save Princess Green Lotus

programme.title: Lost in the Stars (1974)
programme.desc: A black South African minister searching the unfamiliar back alleys and shantytowns of Johannesburg for his missing son. Musical drama, starring Brock Peters and Melba Moore

programme.title: Frieda (1947)
programme.desc: An RAF officer returns home after the Second World War, having broken out of a prisoner of war camp. He brings with him his new wife - a German woman who helped him escape. However, family and friends struggle to accept the marriage - especially when her brother comes to visit. Drama based on Ronald Millar's stage play, starring Mai Zetterling and David Farrar

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alphans come into contact with an alien craft, and Maya persuades the crew to help release the prisoner it is carrying. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: The Bearded Vulture is one of the largest birds of prey in Europe and one of the rarest

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: When Reggie loses his job at the pig farm, he and Elizabeth decide to find something they can work at together, so they consult with Jimmy. Classic 1970s comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Pauline Yates and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Alan tries to secure the safe seat of Kensington and Chelsea and return to political prominence. However, his ambition is cut short when he is diagnosed with cancer. In a secluded hospital, nursed by Jane, he loses his greatest battle. John Hurt and Jenny Agutter star. Part of The Thatcher Years strand

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Triple Cross (1966)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War spy adventure about Eddie Chapman, a bank robber who became a British double agent in exchange for money and a full pardon. Following the German invasion of Jersey, Chapman offers to provide information to the Nazis, who are unaware his loyalties really lie with the British Secret Service. With Christopher Plummer, Trevor Howard, Yul Brynner, Romy Schneider and Claudine Auger

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Sam Kelly's Station House
programme.desc: Sam Kelly, the original drummer with 1970s funk band Cymande, brings his blues & soul band to the screen with a recorded show performing tracks from their No Barricades album

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Alan tries to secure the safe seat of Kensington and Chelsea and return to political prominence. However, his ambition is cut short when he is diagnosed with cancer. In a secluded hospital, nursed by Jane, he loses his greatest battle. John Hurt and Jenny Agutter star. Part of The Thatcher Years strand

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: Cassy, Vern and Gus are gifted students who go to an enchanted school to learn about magic. After receiving a book named UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells) they soon begin their journey of a lifetime

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: The downtrodden Harvey battles with his wife when her affairs make caring for their son difficult

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: The duo infiltrate an organisation for geniuses, and discover their fellow members are being brainwashed by a sinister matron into committing audacious crimes. Light-hearted drama, starring Diana Rigg and Patrick Macnee

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: On a foggy night in London, Gary wanders into the unknown and has a close encounter with a notorious criminal, but that is just the start of his problems. Time-travelling comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: When Reggie loses his job at the pig farm, he and Elizabeth decide to find something they can work at together, so they consult with Jimmy. Classic 1970s comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Pauline Yates and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Last Holiday (1950)
programme.desc: A man believes he has a terminal disease, prompting him to embark on a final fling abroad. Comedy, starring Alec Guinness and Kay Walsh

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Glen Garriff Lion Reserve faces disaster after disaster. A fire burns out of control on a neighbouring farm and threatens to spread to Glen Garriff, where a vital piece of firefighting equipment is out of action

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place. Part one of five

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out again to explore some of Britain's finest habitats and most spectacular wildlife, beginning in Scotland's Caledonian pine forests, home to rare species including the capercaillie. Ray camps out in the hope of catching the turkey-sized grouse's courtship display, and also goes in search of the red squirrel

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: Documentary in which rarely-seen archive footage and expert interviews identify and rank history's most influential military equipment. The series begins with a look at aircraft, from the P51 Mustang through to the modern Harrier jump jet

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: The parents of Lorraine Benson revisit the moment their missing daughter's body was found. Meanwhile, Met police investigators look back at the tragic case

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Hands of a Murderer (1990)
programme.desc: The sleuth pursues his arch-enemy Moriarty, who has escaped the gallows and is plotting to steal top-secret information from British intelligence. When Holmes foils his scheme, Moriarty kidnaps the detective's spymaster brother with the intention of forcing him to reveal all his secrets. Detective drama, starring Edward Woodward, John Hillerman and Anthony Andrews

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: Car Trouble (1986)
programme.desc: A sexually unsatisfied woman realises her husband's beloved new car means more to him than her. She has a fling with a salesman that accidentally results in the destruction of the precious vehicle, and consumed by rage, the husband plans a murderous revenge. Comedy, starring Julie Walters, Ian Charleson and Stratford Johns

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: This special extended episode shows what goes into the production of London's newest electric taxi

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. programme.title: The Hundred Live
programme.desc: Manchester Originals Men v Birmingham Phoenix Men. Live coverage of the match from Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester. The home side will be looking to go one better than they did last year, after they lost to Trent Rockets in last year's final. This meeting last year ended in a comprehensive victory for the Originals as they made 154-6 in their hundred balls, before they bowled out the Phoenix for just 75 to win by 79 runs

programme.desc: Leicester City v Coventry City (Kick-off 12.00pm). Live coverage of the Championship match at King Power Stadium, as both sides begin their campaigns.
